title: chocolat blanc
content:
Chocolat Blanc? What is this typeface? Please help!!! :(

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Pierre-Marcolini-tablette-de-chocolat-blanc.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418193650/http:/typophile.com/files/Pierre-Marcolini-tablette-de-chocolat-blanc.JPG) | 73.51 KB |
author: ragusad

comments.content:
I like [Goldenbook](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418193650/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/goldenbook) but I don't think that's the one mainly because of /T and /A crossbar.

EDIT: closer look [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418193650/http:/1.bp.blogspot.com/-NJk2ZOrcZh8/UII9ZmPJkvI/AAAAAAAAEKU/hiKk8ugg5uw/s1600/IMG_2223.jpg) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418193650/http:/www.marcolini-eboutique.com/publishingImages/catalog/TR00021_large.jpg). More samples and letters [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418193650/http:/www.marcolini-eboutique.com/en-en/tablets-and-treats?category=Tablets(Marcolini-Base)). Reminds me of [Trajan](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418193650/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/trajan) (/N missing top left serif /N, /M slopping verticals) but that's clearly not it. Some more I like: [Minerva Antiqua](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418193650/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/minerva), [Orpheus](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418193650/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/orpheus-pro).

you could always ask the source:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418193650im_/http:/typophile.com/files/snap_4638.png)

You guys are unbelievable!!!!!  
And yes; I could have asked the source. Duh for me, why have I not even think about it!?

THANKS SO MUCH!!!

Surprising that nobody has come up with the answer. Serifs are clearly not my specialty but, with such a /Q, faux small-caps and the rest set in Engravers Gothic/Blair, I really doubt a bespoke typeface has been drawn especially for this occasion.
